intro: Anaphalis lanata, commonly known as the woolly cudweed, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its dense, white, woolly foliage that covers the stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows, woodlands, and stream banks. Anaphalis lanata is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
